tracks.name: Room 3
tracks.description: ground floor, owned by Cluj JavaScripters

tracks.name: Room 4
tracks.description: first floor, owned by Tabăra de Testare

tracks.name: Room 6
tracks.description: first floor, owned by PM Elite

sessions.title: State of the nation: What will the future bring us?
Typechecking JavaScript
sessions.description:
Why is it important to use type checker tools with JavaScript projects that need to scale?
We'll go through the basics of typechecking and see what tools are there to help us.

sessions.title: Cross-browser test automation framework model with Selenium Webdriver, Cucumber and Docker
sessions.description: This presentation will analyze the building blocks needed for a  test automation framework built with Java, Selenium Webdriver, Cucumber, and running in Docker containers. The purpose of such a framework is to allow  parallel, cross-browser testing in lightweight and independent containers, in order to minimize the infamous flakiness associated with Wedbriver. The presentation is intended as a guide for those who are new to test automation, but also for those who feel like they would want to improve the way they do things.

sessions.title: Effective Scrum
sessions.description:
Description:
Nowadays, there is quite a big hype around agile software development. Trainers and organizations are almost obsessively preaching the Scrum Framework, referring to it as a silver bullet and by its introduction they envision The Land of Milk and Honey. Often they are missing the most important point: hands-on experience. What works well? What makes it work?
Benefits of Scrum / The Dark Side

sessions.title: Predict the future in 10 minutes or less - an introduction to Azure Machine Learning
sessions.description:
Software is eating the world and AI is doing its best to help. 

Join me in this session and find out how you can use machine learning to make accurate predictions and get a solution up and running as fast as possible, with (almost) no prior knowledge.

sessions.title: How to build an eCommerce module? 5 ways to !fail
sessions.description: Given the complex ecosystem of hundreds of eCommerce platforms, here you can find a generic approach to successfully build eCommerce modules in a professional way.

sessions.title: RXJava comes to Android. How should I start?
sessions.description:
"Reactive" you've probably been hearing this word recently a lot in the Android world. It’s a fashionable, new paradigm for modelling asynchronous events in a composable, declarative way.
Once you get the hang of it, the code becomes more elegant, more readable and everything wires together nicely.
We will discuss about what is reactive programming, how can we start, how can we use it in Android and some useful techniques and tips and tricks.

sessions.title: Pitch IT!
sessions.description:
Tell your story in front of top accelerators and local investors! Get valuable feedback and attract attention of the local startup community. Apply here: https://readyforstartups.co/
 
This talk is part of a series of talks powered by ReadyForStartups.co

sessions.title: The challenges of building an online game service
sessions.description: We'll dive head first into the technical challenges of building an online multiplayer game.  I'll be talking about game client architecture, server infrastructure, matchmaking and our approach to storing and handling persistent player data and how these systems work together to deliver a solid multiplayer experience.

sessions.title: Meet the geeks - play&learn
sessions.description: Meet our students and dare to play a game of chess or UNO with them. Are you up for the challenge?

sessions.title: Happy to Collaborate - The Virtual BA
sessions.description:
During my professional experience in the field of Business Analysis, I have come across many challenges, but one of the roughest was the one of moving from eliciting and facilitating classical meetings to the virtual meetings. Nowadays, there is an increased number of Business Analysts that are not working at the client site. 
They work for global organizations as well as organizations interested in approaching creative ways to reduce costs which may result in having Business Analysts working remotely.
Dissimilar classical meetings, in virtual environments the Business Analyst is not capable of interpreting the stakeholder’s body language, gather eye signals and facial expressions to determine if participants as well as stop individuals from multi – tasking which takes away their full attention to the meeting at hand.
This presentation has as main objective the illustration of tips and tricks for BA enthusiasts improving their skills in working with virtual teams.

sessions.title: Writting useful automated tests for the Single Page Applications you build
sessions.description: To be filled in

sessions.title: Write meaningful stories with Git
sessions.description: We've all seen our share of messy git logs. Let's talk about some best practices for being a good Git citizen, from how to write a meaningful commit message to powerful git commands.

sessions.title: Deploying and Orchestrating Docker Containers in Microsoft Azure
sessions.description: In this session we will explore the different options for running Docker containers on Microsoft Azure and how to orchestrate large applications using Azure Container Service and Kubernetes,  DC/OS and Docker Swarm.

sessions.title: Roles in Agile
sessions.description: This talk is an attempt to contrast the commonly known roles in agile projects to practice and to explore if and how a Project Manager can add value in this context.

sessions.title: Panel: A startup is not a smaller version of a big company!
sessions.description: It takes only a few good people to build a startup. Let’s talk with some of the local companies that have begun the transition from outsourcing to product development to see what kind of people we need to build products, how we find them, how do we keep them motivated to put in sweat and blood while building a product.

sessions.title: Social Coding
sessions.description: We are born to code.  Do you know a new trick? Let's talk about it.

sessions.title: Compilers in Angular
sessions.description: The presentation aims to go over the way the Just-in-time (JIT) and Ahead-of-time (AOT) compilers work within Angular 2 framework and delve deeper into the subject by explaining the key differences in implementation and performance

sessions.title: The Parrot Scale - a quick guide to Stakeholders interaction
sessions.description: Interested in detecting undercover parrots? Us too. Come join us at the presentation and lets sharpen our skills together.

sessions.title: Part 1: Game Development Startups - a different ballgame / Part 2: Games - From Post-it to Product
sessions.description:
Part 1 (Alexandru Palade): The game development industry generated $91bn in revenue in 2016. Starting a game development studio can be very rewarding - both financially and creatively - but it's also challenging and presents significant differences from the usual IT startup. Join me on a dive to explore the unique challenges of forming, funding and managing a game development venture.

Part 2 (Flaviu Vescan): This talk is about the process behind getting a game idea from a sentence on a Post-it note to a Shipped Product. It focuses on how to best structure the project into a production pipeline that a small team could work on in order to avoid the most common pitfalls game developers and designers face.

sessions.title: Forms in Angular
sessions.description: orms are probably the most sensitive part of your web app. They are the main way we get data from the user. They seem simple enough, you just add an ngForm to your template, user clicks Submit and you have data. But there's more to them than that, and we're going to talk about that in this session. We'll try building forms in 2 ways: FormControls and FormBuilder. We'll then proceed to add Validations to one of the forms, touching on available Validations and then creating our custom one. We'll then look at the valueChanges Observable and handle changes to our form.

sessions.title: Reactive Javascript
sessions.description: What is rxJS and how can you push your Javascript out of bed and into this reactive land full of unicorns and dark magic?  In this talk,  you'll get aquainted with rxJS and and the benefits it brings to the JS libraries table.

sessions.title: Adaptability in the QA Engineering field
sessions.description: Adaptability is one of the key characteristics for survival and this definitely also applies to the dynamical field of QA Engineering. Where did this field appear from? How was it at the beginning and where is it now? But most importantly: Where is it going? Where will the testers be in a couple of years? What tools should they manage? These are a couple of questions that I would like to address and also talk about the challenges we will encounter, what are the predictions for the following years and how can we adapt. The QA is no longer a resource that can be allocated to any type of project and, technology now matters, EVEN for the QA.

sessions.title: Agile experiences in the biomedical world: How we improved productivity, boosted team morale and got better results
sessions.description: Building biomedical systems implies a great number of challenges. With a direct impact on the lives of sometimes millions of people, safety is a critical factor, quality  issues being unacceptable. This presentation will share a story on how we managed to adopt agile practices in a highly regulated environment in order to improve the development of a state of the art robotic molecular analyzer. Throughout this talk you will see how a series of seemingly small changes had a very big impact, reinforcing the idea that improvement can come from anyone.

sessions.title: Microservices in Practice
sessions.description: A pragmatic approach for building a microservice architecture that fits well with modern distributed applications and cloud technologies.

sessions.title: Multiple machine learning approaches for detecting computer network attacks
sessions.description: Fighting against cyber-attacks has gained more and more attention in domains like banking, social media and politics. Computer networks have met a rapid growth in terms of size and technology which also raised the probability of network attacks by unauthorized users, including perhaps insiders. In this talk, we will give an overview to some of the machine learning algorithms and discuss about when to apply a supervised or unsupervised algorithm. In the end we will have a small practical presentation of two approaches applied for predicting network attacks.

sessions.title: Totul conectat
sessions.description: Despre Internet of Things si pericolele pe care le prezinta noul teren de joaca al hackerilor. Talk lejer despre IoT pentru home si putin mentionat IoT industrial (mai mult ca o scurta comparatie).

sessions.title: How to do business internationally?
sessions.description: An open discussion with Bogdan Oros about the challenges of taking a Romanian hardware product to over 80 countries and negotiating with major players of the world's IT industry.

sessions.title: Gaming with Microsoft Azure
sessions.description: TBD

sessions.title: Gamification is education
sessions.description: So many things have changed in the past 20 years. Learning and development is following the same trend. See how.

sessions.title: Navigating the waves of uncertainty: a young tekkie’s guide to taking over the world
sessions.description: Even in today’s IT market, there are challenges and hurdles to overcome in getting, not the best, but “the right” place. A couple of (somewhat) experienced Project Managers - and not only :) - are on a mission to guide youngsters (and not only) to an easier path to landing the “dream” job

sessions.title: The result of test evolution
sessions.description: A journey from the prehistoric excel to the modern  dashboards. A talk in which everyone can find his current situation, with tips and tricks on how to go to the next level of testing. In the presentation we will cover everything from exploratory test result storage to automation test reporting. Successfully combining  the  automation workflows with test case management tools and continuous integration.

sessions.title: Building interactive 3D worlds in the browser
sessions.description:
We will do an introduction into 3D and WebGL basics, live coding demonstration and a bunch of tips & tricks on how to tweak performance and perceived performance & quality.
You’ll learn how to build 3D games and applications that run without any plugin right from the browser - even on mobile. You’ll see how you can start creating this content today and how to bring it to production quality.

sessions.title: Azure Data Lake for super-developers
sessions.description: Nowadays digital information is produced by each device that we touch. What we do after we receive this data can change the way how we do business, but to be able to store and process this data we need a powerful system like Azure Data Lake. This session we will discover the secrets that are behind Azure Data Lake and why this service should be on our roadmap.

sessions.title: PM Skillset. PMI Talent Triangle.
sessions.description: A talk about PMI's vision onto what skills a PM needs to have/ further develop.

sessions.title: Before and after the Code
sessions.description:
Products don't just happen. They show up because people need a solution to an issue. In taking an idea from thought to reality there is a long journey with many crossroads. The job of an UX designer is to make sure developers access the right map to deliver the best product for the right audience. 

What happens when the audience is the entire population? That's when things get really interesting. Developing for the client versus developing for social good is a challenge worth taking on at any moment. I'd like to talk to you about how building digital solutions for the people feels like.

sessions.title: Computer Vision on the road using OpenCV
sessions.description: Some intermediate computer vision techniques for identifying elements of interest on the road.

sessions.title: You suck at showcasing your game
sessions.description:
After showcasing my game "Move or Die" at over fifteen events worldwide in countries like the US, UK, Japan, Vienna, Germany, Romania, Denmark and more, I have compiled a list of the most important aspects of creating a great experience for players on the show floor. This talk is the distillation of my learnings, which can be summed up in three main points: Show floor presence, Player experience and Follow up. My aim is to demystify the process of showing games at events for new developers, and teach them how to sidestep the many common pitfalls.

I will go in-depth with a variety of things I have learned including visual identity, how to grab the player's attention, building an effective booth, how to talk about your game, the importance of spectators, play session times, showcasing as a source of motivation, the importance of networking and mixer parties, optimizing your game so it runs on its own, wired vs wireless controllers, how to handle sound, various ways of applying for conventions, documenting the experience, showcasing as a form of play testing, why flyers are horrible and why people should stop printing them, giveaways and what both you and the player takes away from the whole experience.

I will also talk about common misconceptions such as "I can't possibly get accepted into big gaming events because I'm a small developer," "recovering exhibition costs by selling copies after events" and "you need a lot of money to exhibit at an event".

Finally, this talk will highlight the most important mistake new developers make when showing their games: Focusing on selling copies rather than networking. Developers showing at events should focus on networking, and realize that just being present at an event can lead to potential collaborations in the future, even without having a booth on the show floor.

sessions.title: Accelerating Cluj: Open panel discussion with Spherik, RiskyBusiness, SprintPoint and MVP Academy
sessions.description: The top accelerators in Cluj-Napoca are going to share insights about their programs, what they are looking for, past experiences and their opinion about the local startup ecosystem.

sessions.title: CSR best practices
sessions.description: With a strong united community we can do wonders. How can you get involved?

sessions.title: UX & Life
sessions.description: Find out how good and bad UX affects people's life and what happens during the UX design process.

sessions.title: Efficiency, an architecture checklist
sessions.description: Efficient software designs support the right user experience for your digital product, for the right amount of money. Now more than ever, in the age of battery-powered devices and of metered computing resources (see "cloud"), we can quantify an efficient software system in terms of dollars and watts, and decide where to make the tradeoff. This presentation is a review of what we should have in mind when architecting for efficiency, from design, to coding, to deployment.

sessions.title: Data Analysis for Machine Learning Systems Design
sessions.description: AI starts to play an increased role in our daily lives. Advances in deep neural networks design after 2010 have allowed development of deep learning based classifiers for natural language processing, concept extraction, emotion analysis, and speech/image recognition. These are now the building blocks for future applications that promise to change and normalize both human-machine and machine-machine interactions. In this talk we will take a closer look at the challenges raised by the machine learning applications, and we will discuss ways we can overcome them.

sessions.title: Are your thinking patterns tricking you?
sessions.description:
Mental shortcuts and cognitive biases are so deeply embedded in our mind that we often fail to notice them in our own or in others’ reasoning. There’s a constant game of trick or treat between the “make-my-life-easier” shortcuts our brain is using and the “studied and desirable” analytical behavior of a professional. The temptation to choose the easy way might be greater than one would suspect and, most of all, prone to a subconscious decision, even for the best intentioned BAs. Important facts and details might be escaping our understanding and consideration, thus our analysis being “just in time” but maybe far from “just enough”.

The presentation will focus on a selection of cognitive biases and mental shortcuts I’ve seen in action at the workplace and their impact on BA/ scrum team/ client related issues.

sessions.title: WebVR for the rest of us
sessions.description: VR has been an "up and coming technology" for the last few decades, but now, it's finally arrived in the hands of everyday consumers. Now you can have VR not just on your $1000 headset, but also your phone and and mobile browser. App-free and hardware-independent, VR is now available to everybody.

sessions.title: Automate your UI testing for Android and iOS apps with the Xamarin Test Cloud
sessions.description: You've done a nice job building your new mobile app - but are your users going to stick around enough to actually use it? Research shows that two thirds of users will quickly abandon your app if it doesn't work well for them. But with hundreds of iOS and Android devices out there, can you reasonably expect to test your app on all of them? Enter Xamarin Test Cloud: a service to help you automate mobile testing on actual, physical devices, improve your app's quality, and give your users that great first impression - all without leaving your own desk.

sessions.title: Why a required ingredient for good UX is a good developer
sessions.description:
In our view, good UX is the product of iteration and willingness to let go of investments made in developing certain features in a certain way. 

Writing software that supports this kind of stress requires serious programming skills.  Being able, as a programmer, to see your code killed because of UX requires programmers that focus on architectures, not code.

This presentation is based upon a "behind the scenes" view into how software is developed at hipMenu - a very popular platform with the IT crowd from Cluj.  We want to present our approach and hopefully engage in a meaningful exchange with participants and even with the broader CodeCamp community.

sessions.title: Game Economy Design Session
sessions.description: High level considerations on economy design, monetisation, analytics, publishing and a crash course in Machinations

sessions.title: The first 1000 users in your startup
sessions.description: Building your product is usually not the hardest thing in your startup. Getting the first 10 users should also be really easy. Even getting to 100 should not be that hard. But the real challenge is to get to 1000 users or more: that's where you need put in place a small marketing machine that starts manufacturing demand and acquiring those users. This talk is about how to build such a machine as a startup founder.

sessions.title: Peer to peer learning - old school coding
sessions.description: You've already been at this stage and you still remember the challenges you had to overcome when being a junior programmer. Why not share some of your knowledge with the gees?

sessions.title: Automatic document classification
sessions.description: Accurate automatic document classification is a difficult problem because it requires natural language processing. Them most known existing solutions have limitations. We propose a new solution that combines several methods: lexical, dictionary-based and vector space-based. The proposed solution offers results superior to the most known open source solutions.

sessions.title: Rancher pentru un environment scalabil
sessions.description:
Rancher este o platforma care permite scalarea unui environment folosind docker.
Ceea ce imi doresc prin aceasta prezentare este sa explic pas cu pas cum poti sa iti realizezi un environment scalabil pentru un traffic cat mai mare pe site. 

Se vor folosi mai multe servere dedicat pentru a demonstra modul in care rancher distribuie dockerele si traficul.
De asemenea solutia va demonstra usurinta cu care se poate muta environment dintr-un datacenter in altul in mod automat.

sessions.title: Continuous Testing within CI/CD
sessions.description:
Continuous Integration, what is it's role in today software development.

What does Continuous Testing mean and how you can achieve it from Developer Perspective through:
	- Microsoft UI Automation
	- JVM Tools Interface

Ilustrate with LeanFT from HPE. Integration with Visual Studio and NUnit.

sessions.title: Tester in Video Game Testing or Software Testing?
sessions.description:
What does it take to become a tester? 
If you are thinking about becoming one and don't know if you have what it takes, this presentation will tell you how to start and what to choose. Also, you will find out what is the best path to follow in order to achieve the status of Professional Tester. 
As a sum-up, Alex will talk about what are the 2017 trends in the field of testing.

sessions.title: Unit Testing in JavaScript
sessions.description: Using Mocha JS, Chai JS and Sinon JS to Test your Frontend JavaScript Code for React Application

sessions.title: BA in Cloud Computing Era
sessions.description:
When it comes to computing, cloud is a word on everybody’s lips nowadays. Cloud computing became a popular concept in IT over the last few years. It is helping organizations to become more agile, responsive and efficient in meeting the business needs. 
This session will focus on what makes the business analyst role so important in cloud specific projects. You will discover what you as a BA need to know when starting a cloud specific project, and some tips & tricks that will help you in your work.

sessions.title: The dark side of containers
sessions.description: Everyone uses containers, we all know the benefits of them, but what about the disadvantages of using them? In this presentation, we will see some container pitfalls and how to minimize the risk that they pose.

sessions.title: Product Metrics and Tools
sessions.description: In product management decisions should be done, mostly, based on data and metrics. In this presentation, we'll discuss about what are the most important metrics to watch depending on the product type and acquisition funnel and how these metrics affect your business and revenue.

sessions.title: Challenge the geeks - games, strategy and fun
sessions.description: Meet our geeks and let them challenge you with a game of chess, UNO or you name it.

sessions.title: Processes, Expertise or Tools - What triggers the excellence?
sessions.description:
Today, for almost all software products or services, there are at least a few competing companies, each trying to get as much market share as possible. To be part of the game and even more, to stay and lead the game, a company at one point needs to perform in a different way. Processes, domain expertise, tools are elements that influence the outcome. Once excellence is reached, identification of the elements that made it possible is easy but the other way around is not.
To better frame the problem: among processes, domain expertise or tools which and how these needs to be changed to reach excellence?
I will talk about a real product that competes with big names and a transformation towards excellence.

sessions.title: Software Development PM beyond standard methodologies
sessions.description: A personal experience and comparison with established methodologies

sessions.title: TechMoney: Prepping for Diligence the Technical Side of Raising Capital
sessions.description:
There's lots of talk on the founder side of things around raising capital and hitting metrics, but what often get's left out is the conversation around the technical work behind making a scalable product and company.

Topics will include:
 - (tech)prepping for investor talks
- setting up development budgets geared towards investors
- planning user growth and scaling during fundraising
- VC approved security(tech)  metrics 
- technical documentation expectations
- Prepping for tech handoffs or escrow

sessions.title: The World of StackOverflow.com
sessions.description:
You may be a front-end developer, a Java guru, a DevOp trying out a few scripts or a college student who is just starting to learn C. In any case, you most likely ended up at least once on StackOverflow.com in search for a coding solution. 

In this session I will take you through the world of StackOverflow, its history and its surrounding ecosystem. We will look at how to use it effectively, learn about who and how is guverning it and explore its many amazing features. We will even look a bit under the hood for some really cool insights.

sessions.title: Testing the UI of your webapp
sessions.description: When we create our Selenium tests, we don’t check how the browser actually renders the page. This is one of the challenges that you may have faced when attempting to automate your tests with Selenium. Wouldn’t it be useful to capture our UI changes constantly together with your Selenium tests? Therefore in this talk I’d like to tell you about an open-source library I developed together with my colleagues at Altom. This library is based on Image Comparison and it helps you automate the process of comparing different sections or elements of web pages. So you can check that your web app LOOKS the way you want it to look. Our focus will be on what this library is, how we can integrate it with our existing Selenium tests, and how a report will look like.

sessions.title: Spice up your mobile apps with Speech API from Microsoft Cognitive Services
sessions.description: Bing Speech API is a RESTful service from Microsoft Cognitive Services which offers Speech-To-Text, Text-To-Speech and Speech Intent Recognition. We will build (using snippets) a Xamarin Forms application that will get voice input as a wav file and feed it into the Bing Speech API to get the text from the audio file. This can be done using a basic REST API client but we will do it via Xamarin Forms .NET SDK.

sessions.title: Building a real-time web application with Angular 2, TypeScript, WebSockets and .NET Core
sessions.description: In this session we will build a real-time Web Chat App in ASP.NET Core using Angular 2, TypeScript, WebSockets, Azure SQL and we will integrate it with Slack.

sessions.title: Breaking a startup: Fwdmarket
sessions.description: "Breaking a startup" is a new type of talk where we invite entrepreneurs to share their experiences in the startups that failed. We believe that failure is the way important lessons are learned. Let's share and learn together! This talk is part of a series of talks powered by ReadyForStartups.co

sessions.title: The evolution of learning
sessions.description: Classical learning vs. informal learning.

sessions.title: Building a Mobile SDK on top of eCommerce APIs
sessions.description:
The session will go through the design, implementation, testing and deployment of a Mobile SDK (iOS & Android) built on top of eCommerce APIs.
 
 I will talk about the high level design, show you code snippets, discuss testing strategy, auto generated documentation, continuous delivery and much more.

sessions.title: Pre-Screening RoIndieVan
sessions.description:
RoIndieVan is the first documentary ever created on the Romanian indie game dev scene.  Studios from Cluj, Timisoara, Iasi, Brasov and Bucuresti open up about their life as game devs in our country. 
Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IFxa_py06v8c

sessions.title: Will "mechanical minds" take my job?
sessions.description:
Remember when humans once displaced horses from their jobs (by creating mechanical muscles such as automobiles)?
Is it possible that the same will happen to human workers? Most certainly, as it's already happening in some industries.

"But I work in IT, I'm in a creative industry. You can't automate creativity!", you will say. While this *might* be true today, it doesn't mean it will be true forever.

Let's explore together what would take for an AI to do your job, why would anyone want to do this and what can you do to make sure you're still relevant in the workforce in 20 years.

sessions.title: The Raffle: Come and Win Your Prizes!
After Party - The Entire Codecamp Community @ TBD

speakers.name: Sorin Peste
speakers.bio:
Sorin has been a part of the large Microsoft family since 2011, and has been busy developing software on the Microsoft stack since 2001. 
As a Technical Evangelist he engages with developers and IT Professionals, showcasing the latest and greatest Microsoft solutions and technology.

He has delivered a number of enterprise solutions, both on premises and in the cloud. 

Sorin likes coding, travelling and riding his motorcycle in his spare time.

speakers.name: Adrian Popovici
speakers.bio:
Since I was a little boy I had an inclination towards math, logic and algorithms. So, at the right moment, programming was a normal path to take.
Went through all kinds of projects and languages but soon realized C++ was the one for me. From signal processing to games development and computer vision I hope to catch them all and live to tell the story.

speakers.name: Alex Comsa
speakers.bio: With experience in multiple branches of the design discipline I have finally settled to UX & UI Design for the last 7 years. My principles: make it clear, keep it simple, don’t waste time, reach the goal.

speakers.name: Alex Lakatos
speakers.bio: Alex Lakatos has been a Mozilla Representative Mentor and contributor to the Mozilla project for the past five years, based in London. JavaScript developer building on the open web, he has been pushing its boundaries every day. You can check out his github profile or get in touch on twitter. When he’s not programming, he likes to travel the world, so it’s likely you’ll bump into him in an airport lounge.

speakers.name: Alex Mos
speakers.bio:
15 Years of Design Experience, last 7 of them as a UX Designer, and last 1.5 at Softvision.

All I do revolves around finding the sweet spot between business goals and user needs and turning it into an engaging, win-win user experience.

speakers.name: Alexandru Hapliuc
speakers.bio: Experienced system engineer(Windows, Linux) with a focus on middleware, automation and security.

speakers.name: Alexandru Palade
speakers.bio: I started my own personal quest in 2016 when I got off the corporate ladder to start an indie games studio.  The video game industry is tough but I'm super passionate about it and eager to use my tech and management experience to create a genuine Romanian start-up.

speakers.name: Alexandru Pavaloi
speakers.bio: Well...fuck the regular "i am 22 years old and passionate about programming". I am gonna tell you that programming is what I do in my busy-time. Because in my free time I'm all about challenges and awesome things. Building cars, starring in movies or tandem skydiving. And my newest challenge is speaking for the CodeCamp conference! Wanna help me do that?

speakers.name: Alexandru Zaharia
speakers.bio: Alexandru started his career in 2010, as a Game Tester for Ubisoft and the passion for testing lead into testing Software products for several companies in different environments, using as many technologies, in order to reach his goal.

speakers.name: Alin Turcu
speakers.bio:
I am very passionate about technology, mobile development especially and I always jump in to try and enforce the new trends in the field.
I have been doing mobile for the past 5 years and I am currently leading a team of 11 engineers in Softvision.
I helped developing more than 10 products until now and I “got my hands dirty” in all areas from DB architecture, Android, iOS and backend code. I never say no to a challenging technology problem.

speakers.name: Anca Corbureanu
speakers.bio: I have 7 years of experience as business analyst on software development projects. I have been exposed to various domains such as pension & investment funds industry, asset management, online payments.

speakers.name: Anca Vescan
speakers.bio: Anca Vescan is the CEO and owner of AXON Soft, where since 1998, together with her team,  have successfully managed software development projects and have used the latest technologies. With  25 years of experience in IT and Hi-Tech, she still gets satisfaction from well-done work with real impact on global level projects.

speakers.name: Andreea Per
speakers.bio: Andreea is the Executive Director of RGDA, the Romanian Game Developers Association

speakers.name: Andrei Sebastian Cîmpean
speakers.bio:
Eons ago, when the universe was still a cold, dark place, I started programming in 48 BASIC. Then came the light, while as a student I dabbled stubbornly with C++ instead of Java.

Dynamic languages started to grow on me after college and now I fancy myself a full stack web developer. 

Although most of my energy goes into delivering ambitious js apps, I’m a software geek with strong opinions about technology, about how a successful product should be built and what makes a great team.

speakers.name: Andrei Spatariu
speakers.bio: Andrei studies  Computer Technology & Information Systems in Bucharest. He has been part of the Microsoft community for the past 2 years, loves coding and learning about new technologies.

speakers.name: Attila Fuzes
speakers.bio: Attila is a software developer with over a decade of experience in a variety of web technologies. He's been enthusiastic about Angular since the project has started and has been following its development closely. In his free time he likes hiking and camping in the outdoors.

speakers.name: Bogdan Colceriu
speakers.bio: I build brands and help others build their own brands.Specialties: branding, marketing

speakers.name: Bogdan Costea
speakers.bio:
I started working as a web developer early on, and found it extremely rewarding. And after so many years of web development, I still find great pleasure in what I do.
Better still, the most rewarding thing I have done was coordinating and managing my team. I enjoyed seeing them grow and I like helping them discover on their own the answers they are looking for.

speakers.name: Bogdan Oros
speakers.bio:
Bogdan is the CEO of Onyx Beacon, one of the leading ibeacon technology providers with customers and partners in more than 70 countries. He is working right now at his 2nd startup, having failed the first one, a mobile customer feedback solution for retailers called TxtFeedback.

Bogdan has a BS in Computer Science from the Technical University of Cluj-Napoca and has worked in the student years in the management team of the local chapter of AIESEC.

speakers.name: Bogdan Petea
speakers.bio: Passionate software developer.

speakers.name: Bogdan Toporan
speakers.bio:
Bogdan Toporan is a R&D Manager, with over 10 years experience with Microsoft Technologies, working on different markets like public services sector, hospitality industry, oil and gas industry and functional testing.

He's got significant experience in different platforms, from web, mobile to desktop applications.

speakers.name: Burz Razvan
speakers.bio: I help brands succeed using today's technologies and produce new media content.

speakers.name: Comanici Paul
speakers.bio: Teach Lead

speakers.name: Constantin Chifor
speakers.bio:
Constantin Chifor founded Quality Software Innovation in 2013, part of  Quality Software Corporation. Quality Software Corporation  was acquired by 8x8, Inc. of San Jose, CA in June 2015.

Constantin has over 15 yeas of experience in developing technologies for energy metering, GPS tracking, healthcare, broadcasting,  contact center, cloud computing.

speakers.name: Corneliu Dascalu
speakers.bio: Developer with over 6 years of experience, passionate about Android and clean code.

speakers.name: Cosmin Stirbu
speakers.bio:
Being a Computer Science graduate I have always been passionate about technology.

My main interests in software development are clean architecture, design patterns and writing testable code.

Keeping up with the latest technology, API updates and technological breakthroughs is a must in order to keep improving myself. 

Over the last couple of years I have been leading a 10+ development team that has been working on several mobile (iOS & Android) applications.

speakers.name: Costa Ciprian
speakers.bio: Doing software development for more then 15 years. Besides using quite a few technologies, I was and am also involved in product definition, implementation, sales, marketing, which offers me a different perspective on how software should be implemented in order for the product to be successful.

speakers.name: Cristian Cătană
speakers.bio:
I've always been interested in making things better so the biomedical field was a perfect fit as it allows me to have a positive impact on the lives of 
millions of people. Working in this field for almost 9 years, I have helped develop robotic analyzers for molecular and imunodiagnostics.
As the leader of the SW Engineering Department at Stratec Biomedical , I focus on improving people, technology and processes so that we can create biomedical products that save and improve people's lives.

speakers.name: Cristian Dascalu
speakers.bio:
Cristian Dascalu is the founder of ClujHUB, part of Transilvania Entrepreneurship & Innovation Center Center, organisation that developed the first incubation program in the region and the entrepreneurial platform www.StartupTransilvania.ro. From 2015 he is managing the SprintPoint Techcelerator program. 

From 2016 he is member of the Romanian National Council on Entrepreneurship & Innovation and member of the board at the www.TETAPOLIS.com Science & Tehnology Park in Cluj-Napoca.

speakers.name: Cristina Morariu
speakers.bio: Cristina Morariu, PhD, PMP – Cristina has obtained the MSc. degree in Computer Science in 2006 at Technical University of Cluj-Napoca and in 2013 obtained her PhD. degree in automatic control at Polytechnics University of Bucharest, Faculty of Automatic Control and Computer Science. She is the mother of two, passionate about Tarantino movies and Artificial Intelligence. As a day to day job, Cristina is a Project Manager at SOFTVISION.

speakers.name: Daniel Homorodean
speakers.bio: Managing Director of Arxia - experienced Romanian web agency specialised in TYPO3, co-founder of PlanningWiz, member of the board of Cluj IT Cluster, avid traveler and mountaineer, always ready for new experiences and new challenges.

speakers.name: Daniela Paun
speakers.bio: Daniela has a business background focused on analysis, starting about 10 years ago in banking (business lending) and consulting, and moved on to being a Business Analyst in a software development company. During these years she’s been exposed to various projects and clients from several industries and learned some interesting lessons along the way, which she is looking forward to share.

speakers.name: Dorin-Viorel Popovici
speakers.bio: 14+ yrs. of delivering high quality software projects and products for customers around the globe (mostly U.S.) within both FP and T&M contexts. 8+ yrs. dedicated entirely to project/ program/ product/ line management.

speakers.name: Ellie Cachette
speakers.bio: Ellie Cachette is General Partner at Cachette Capital, a Fund of Funds which specializes in venture capital investing. Ellie has a background as an mobile app developer as well as technical project manager and is also the author of Guide to Software Development Agreements. Ellie lives in New York but often works in Bucharest and Cluj.

speakers.name: Flaviu Vescan
speakers.bio:
I was born a human on the magnificent day 19th of June, 1991. I continued my life as a human for a while but started ascending towards another plane of existence by munching on salty books, spicy games and cheesy music. I've been told I graduated with a degree in Telecom from UTCN but I don't believe them. For the past 4 years I've been trying to make good games at Evozon Game Studios, but unfortunately I had to settle with making  brilliant ones :p
<insert beer and/or coffee for more>

speakers.name: Florisca Levente
speakers.bio: After a few years of learning and working I was asked to tutor, teach and train others in the magical land of automation and testing. I've been holding workshops and training at companies for more than 2 years now. I've worked at several companies, on multiple technologies, some challenging, others less challenging.

speakers.name: Gabriel Bitis
speakers.bio: Passionate developer, focusing effort in sharing good technical stuff with others.

speakers.name: Gabriel Dombri
speakers.bio:
Gabriel worked as Digital Marketing Strategist in London until 2015, where he also launched Startcelerate, an investment platform for startups and IT companies.

Since 2016, he is CEO @Tapptitude, the Full-stack Mobile Product Agency.

More than 9 years of hands-on experience in Digital Marketing Strategy and Business Performance Optimisation, during which he advised, consulted and helped grow over 25 companies in the UK, Italy, Germany, US & Romania.

speakers.name: Iulian Dogariu
speakers.bio: I am a technical lead, systems architect and hands-on Java, Scala and Ruby programmer.

speakers.name: Iuliana Roman-Popovici
speakers.bio:
QA Engineer working on both automation and manual testing in an american based company in Cluj-Napoca. I started my career in 2011 on Odesk freelance platform, followed by 3 years of working in a Dutch company in Iasi. Last year I decided to join the Cluj IT community by moving to the "Silicon Valley of Romania”.
I have a major in Computer Science and a master’s degree in Project Management.

speakers.name: Jens Kesselheim
speakers.bio:
A native German, I have also lived in Norway and now Romania. I enjoy working with smart people in challenging environments and firmly believe that it is important to have a positive impact on your community.

During the last eight years (and counting), I gained substantial experience in international management and project management. I have solid understanding on what it takes for the project team to deliver the value the organization is looking for.

speakers.name: Jobava
speakers.bio: Free software enthusiast, Mozillian, Wikipedian, futurist.

speakers.name: Laurentiu Stamate
speakers.bio: I am a self-motivated person, passionate about interacting with new technologies and willing to learn as much as possible in order to surpass myself.

speakers.name: Livia Mihalce
speakers.bio:
Livia is a Business Analyst, with over 7 years experience, working on different markets like asset management, insurance and manufacturing.
She values quality, human interactions and collaborative work, her aim goal being to help business implement best solution on time.

speakers.name: Marcel Cremene
speakers.bio: Dupa 15 ani de cariera didactică în domeniul telecomunicațiilor, în care am ajuns să am drept de conducere de doctorat, am ales să mă angajez ca programator Java la firma 8x8.

speakers.name: Marius Baghiu
speakers.bio: Interested in supervillans with no respect for the status quo.

speakers.name: Marius Bandre
speakers.bio: A guy that wears many hats (husband, father, manager, computer science geek, colleague, friend) with the ambition to play the right role for every context.

speakers.name: Martin Splitt
speakers.jobTitle: Google Developer Expert, Lead Software Engineer
speakers.bio:
Martin is pretty decent at humaning and pretty good at computering,
so he decided to use his computering to improve his and other's humaning.

He loves the open web and open source and helps to make things better with, but not limited to, code.

speakers.name: Matei Neagos
speakers.bio: Started around 8 years ago as a 24/7 support engineer and wore a lot of different hats during these years. Passionate about leadership, dogs and good movies.

speakers.name: Mihai Gheza
speakers.bio: I'm an economy designer / monetisation specialist, focused on free2play mobile games. While at SYBO Games I've worked on Blades of Brim and had the chance to do analytics for Subway Surfers; other notable work includes gamification for LEGO or economy design assistance for Fun Run Arena. I’ve recently relocated to my home town - Brasov - and started www.pixelram.com

speakers.name: Mihai Zugravu
speakers.bio:
Mihai is a former corporate guy with an awesome self proclaimed sense of humour. Always trying to challenge status quo for the best, continuously improve on things and sometimes positively influence stuff.

He started learning about Project Management things a while back, continued with Agile frameworks, often finding himself in search for the right equation to perfectly balance the Universe. 

Currently involved in a skunkworks research & development project for time travel.

speakers.name: Mircea Vadan
speakers.bio:
Mircea’s focus is on digital products and acceleration programs for tech startups. Along the years he worked in 3 startups as business developer, marketing or product manager.

In the last two years he focused on creating acceleration programs for startups and workshops on topics like customer validation, product definition, product metrics, user acquisition, user engagement and investment.

speakers.name: Monica Catana - Petraru
speakers.bio:
Monica likes working with people in multinational environments that are struggling with tricky situations: uncertain, with ambiguous requirements, stakeholders who need to be engaged and teams dispersed in different locations.
Being a true advocate of the Business Analysis profession, Monica together with a team of BA mentors, has succeeded in implementing and running the first Business Analysis Program in Romania that allows skilled professionals to make a turnover in their careers.

speakers.name: Monica Tarmure
speakers.bio:
Working with people is my passion, aiming to build strong, long-lasting relationships and eventually connecting people and projects with each-other. 

With 8 years experience,  in NGOs and 4  years in HR, I really think that people are the most valuable asset  that will make your business succeed. 

My belief is that doing the things you love will always bring the best results.

speakers.name: Nagy Melinda
speakers.bio: Melinda Nagy is a Software Tester at Altom, where she has been working for 2 years. Passionate about Test Automation projects, she is trying to improve her coding skills continuously. She is also a student at Babes-Bolyai University - Computer Science, Master's Degree - Specialisation Databases.

speakers.name: Nicolae Berbece
speakers.bio: Nicolae Berbece is an indie game developer from Romania and the designer of Move or Die, the friendship ruining party game. He founded his own company "Those Awesome Guys", where he teams up with developers from all over the world in order to create highly polished games. He is also the creator of the "Free Controller prompts pack" used in tens of games, including Mega Man Legacy, Postal, Shadow Warrior 2 and several others.

speakers.name: Nicolae Oprean
speakers.bio:
- QA Engineer since 2010
- Passionate into Performance testing
- Speaker at TestCon.lt in 2016 
- Speaker at TestCon Moscow 2017

speakers.name: Oana Iamandi
speakers.bio: Project Manager with Lola Tech

speakers.name: Olivia Vereha
speakers.bio: After working in online media for many years, I now dedicate all my time to UX and CX.  I am a core team member and an UX designer for Code4Romania and I also deliver beginner courses on usability and UX essentials for juniors. I am passionate about how technology can shape and improve our day to day lives and I am always willing to help in any way I can in building great digital tools for our society.

speakers.name: Paul Chirila
speakers.bio:
Tech enthusiast, out of shape developer and really funny guy. 

I'm a self-made entrepreneur interested in startups, and co-founder of a few. For the past ten years I've had the pleasure of continuously building the great team of people that surround me at Around25.

speakers.name: Radu Cristea
speakers.bio: Radu is a veteran software developer, having seen and worked with codebases large and small. Besides the "normal" coding he does for financial trading, he is a seasoned game developer. He puts his years of industry programming experience to use as a Tech Director for Rikodu, where they are working on their first game!

speakers.name: Radu Matei
speakers.bio:
Radu studies Automatic Control and Computer Science and is a Technical Evengelist @Microsoft, engaging with developer communities.
 
 He has been part of the Microsoft community for the past 4 years as a Microsoft Student Partner, he enjoys coding and is fascinated by new technologies.

speakers.name: Radu Murzea
speakers.bio: A backend PHP developer, Symfony-Framework fan, tech enthusiast, writer, speaker and generally a fun guy to be around. I'm a moderator on StackExchange, where I manage their poker community. I'm never afraid to get my hands dirty with various technologies.

speakers.name: Radu Vunvulea
speakers.bio:
Radu Vunvulea is a technology enthusiast involved in all kind of projects. He has a vast experience on different technologies and industries and has a blog where he writes about IT trends. In his free time he drives IT communities and speaks at different conferences around the world.
In his day to day life Radu is Solution Architect at iQuest Technologies and Microsoft Azure MVP. Most of his time is working with cloud helping big enterprises to innovate and find solutions to business problems.

speakers.name: Razvan Vuscan
speakers.bio: Razvan values quality over anything else. He is a firm advocate of continuously trying to do things as best as possible, and not giving into half-measures. He believes that both client satisfaction and tester pride are two of the most important pillars upon which the QA practice should be built. In the quest for perfecting his work he believes that there are always new things to learn and ways to improve one's skills. He is also a promoter of knowledge sharing and collaborative growth.

speakers.name: Roxana Rugină
speakers.bio: I’m a technologist and communication expert engaged in social and disruptive innovation. For several years I worked in startups, in advertising agencies, with corporations and governmental institutions. I am very good with people and project management. I use digital tools and design thinking to solve problems. After my experience with Simplon Romania where we turn your talent into a career in tech, I realised how many people want to start their career into entrepreneurship.

speakers.name: Sotoc Sergiu Alexandru
speakers.bio:
Passioned about informatics.
Obtained the AI master degree at UBB university in 2016.

speakers.name: Stefan Sarbu
speakers.bio: I always wanted to work on a Made in Romania digital product. Every step in my journey has been towards that objective and now I can do it. What's stopping you?

speakers.name: Székely Sipos Sándor Zolta
speakers.bio:
I am fortunate enough to love what I do: use my expertise to establish and develop software development teams by helping employees develop and pursue meaningful learning goals and hiring the right people.

Specialties: strategic planning ♦ change management ♦ employee career development ♦ compensation management ♦ recruitment ♦ risk management ♦ budgeting ♦ conflict solving ♦ software architecture ♦ design ♦ implementation ♦ testing ♦ agile

speakers.name: Tudor Ciuleanu
speakers.bio: With an endless passion for his business and the vision of the new generation of leaders, Tudor Ciuleanu drives an active environment at Imprezzio Global. Tudor accepted in 2008 the challenge to set Imprezzio’s, a USA company, roots in Romania. During these years, Tudor grew the business from a small development department into a trustworthy partner for customers all around the world. His key drivers are enabling the team’s potential and making sure that customer expectations are met every time.

speakers.name: Vlad Iliescu
speakers.bio:
Vlad has been developing software in an unprofessional manner for over two decades. He has also developed software professionally for more than half of that time. Passionate about teaching complex topics and ideas, Vlad strives to keep his audience both educated and entertained. 
 
You should come to his presentation.
